commit_list.message:
New, shiny and unit-tests meta-info system for entities. This means that you can now query e.g. what kind of type an object is and what is it's parent class and what are it's child classes.
Additionally, you can attach arbitrary extended information to each class. This will be used in ui subsystem to attach the corresponding view-factory to an entity class.

commit_list.message:
Marked all abstract classes as abstract in the docs.
Every class deriving from entity that is not abstract got a new getDomain()-implementation.
Added missing domains and unit-tests for all the getDomain()-functions.
The literal that is used in an literal_expression is no longer a component of the literal - this was false, because the literal_expression does not necessarily become the parent of the literal.
commit_list.repo_description: The Omni Programming Language

commit_list.message:
Added the class 'scope' as a new base-class for statements, etc.
Added the concept of 'components' for entities - components are sub-entities of an entity. For example, a variable's initialization expression is a component of the variable_declaration_expression. Or the function parameter expressions are components of the function_call_expression, and so on.
Removed the necessity to provide a parent to entities in the ctor - the parent will be set as soon as the entity is used as some kind of component of another entity.

There are a lot of unit-tests to add - see "missing tests.txt".
commit_list.repo_description: The Omni Programming Language

commit_list.message:
Moved `module' to namespace model
Added class `scope', which is the new base-class for all "active" parts of the model
getContext (), getModule () and getParent() are now part of the base class `entity'
Every entity must have a parent passed in the ctor (this will be changed in the next commit)

WARNING: Tests are broken with this commit. They will be fixed in the next one.

commit_list.message:
Added support for variables to omni! They can be declared (variable_declaration_statement), a value can be assigned to them (variable_assignment_expression) and their value can be used as an expression (variable_expression).
This is the first higher-level construct than what llvm already does that omni introduces. More to come!

commit_list.message:
Replaced tabs with four spaces.
Made the test-cases work, added a cast to the actual test data type to forbid widening of the result type (e.g. from signed short to signed int, rendering the potential correct result larger or smaller than the range of a signed short can be).
For failed tests, .ll files will now be placed in the tests directory. These can be used to track down the reason for the test failure.
Updated llvm and clang to the latest HEAD (now already more than a week old, though), had to ignore more warnings because of warnings in llvm/clang code.

commit_list.message:
The first test suite contextTests now runs successfully. It test whether the context is able to write assembly files (.ll), object files (.o or .obj) or shared object files (.so, .dylib or .dll).
The test even loads a created shared object file and runs a function that was previously created using omni::take2::function that contains an return_expression that returns a literal with the value 42.
All this is currently only implemented for Windows.

commit_list.message:
New project: take2
This is a second take at writing omni. This second take goes from low-level to high-level (e.g. from expressions, statements and functions to classes, namespaces and modules).
So far, the sandbox_take2 can already emit LLVM IR code for a function that adds two integer literals. That's great \o/
